definitions.definition: an article or a story that you cut from a newspaper or magazine and keep
definitions.labels: (both British English)North American English, British English

examples.text: She had kept all the press cuttings about the murder.

definitions.definition: a piece cut off a plant that will be used to grow a new plant

examples.text: Take geranium cuttings in late summer.
After about four weeks you will be able to see whether the cuttings have taken.
Take cuttings from mature plants in the spring.
These plants are easy to propagate from leaf cuttings.
You can see whether the cuttings have taken.

definitions.definition: a narrow open passage that is dug through high ground for a road, railway or canal
